body:
Due to recent events, my time here will be sporadic with long periods of off time. Eventually, I hope that I'll be able to phase out and lose complete interest here.
Or I might just regain interest and whatnot, who knows. All I know is that I need a break from here for awhile or forever probably.

Warning: This is NOT a hate post. 

I tried to stop myself from making this post and just "phase out". Quitely with no post. But that isn't fair to me because I think that for all that I've contributed and how well that I communicated with you guys and my efforts to help create an amiable and fair atmosphere... I think that I deserve a little more communication than just an abrupt demotion. 

I woke up and found out what happened as soon as I logged on. I talked to Snow about what has been happening to me prior to my demotion and he understood well enough while pointing what I did wrong and what I should've done. He said that everyone has their moments.

I accepted these facts and I admit that I should've handled things a little better. But this isn't fair.

Staff-Mods:
You guys are really great people to talk to. I may have handled the situation with Michael badly but the least I deserved was a talk about what has been happening and a notification directly to me instead of an immediate demotion. This is what everyone was talking about when there is very little communication. Talk to me about the situation before taking actions.

When i handled the TS affair before I was involved, I made sure that I talked and listened to both parties and I actively communicated and recorded both of 'em. No bias and a lot of communication. This example should've been followed.

Just before I was demoted, I had a talk with Snow about what was happening to me on the last days before I was demoted. I faced constant harassment and opposition from Michael's and DaGoldBrick's groups. I understand why I was demoted but the least I deserved was a little chat about why these things have been happening and what we can do to fix. 

Especially since I was really dedicated to the job and I handled reports quite nicely. I talked to people casually enough and was quite active. To just... demote me randomly... no notice no less... is rude. 

It took two Seniors to tell me what happened. They listened to my point of view and what has been happening to me recently.

And this could've all been avoided if certain people, were already banned from all of Avicus' services. I'm pretty sure if anyone else tried this nonsense they would be banned quite promptly. I am appalled and angered by what I have been witnessing. Despite the risks, these things could've been avoided if every staff member opened their eyes sooner (With the exception of a few).

The reputation... the racist jokes... It's so obvious guys.

Staff-MapDevs:
I thought we were friends. You guys didn't even give me a direct notice from Skype. Just a Gmail notice... It was abrupt just like the moderators were and I thought we were more friendly than this.

Not even a "goodbye" or a "Thank you for your service". Especially since this was the position that I worked the hardest for and that I was surrounded by friendly people. I feel hurt and wounded. 

I admit that I was a bit rude to the antagonizers. But not "Excessively", this happened over a period of about 2 days. And my responses were only a little insulting. Not overwhelmingly insulting. 

Besides the screenshots of the Pokes I sent to Zacc (Which can easily look like I started the problem. He didn't record his own voice and the responses that he sent to me.). I was called a "Pussy" and judged based on where I lived. I was heavily antagonized throughout the few days and I find it hurtful that I'm the one called rude.

Even if I was rude, I wasn't "Excessively" rude and I tried my best to dumb down the situation and ignore the rest of the posts directed at me. Well, thanks for letting me experience being a MapDev atleast... heheh... *Slouches*.

Players: Try not to give the Staff team too much work and flak, alright? If you want to make posts criticizing their actions... do them constructively. What they did wrong, what they're doing right, how should they improve?

Dregs: You keep dumbing down Avicus and pissing people off... One day, you might do this to the wrong person and you will have to answer to some or a lot of people. Whether it be one person or your government. Keep at it.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________________

Now that this is over, I would like to call out some people who I believe deserve my praise for being friends and great people.

Para: This guy is one of the most intelligent and aware people that I've ever met. He's a great person who is one of the most ancient and one of the greater staff members out there. Hello man, things didn't work out in the end for me. But oh well, if I ever get interested in Avicus again we can hang out a bit. Possibly we can hang out on Steam if you wish. Oh and Admins, promote this guy to Senior plox!

Evo: A great person, a great Map Maker and a great Head MapDev. One of my first friends here along with Para. See you later, I hope. Good luck leading the team with Sli :)

Poker: A great friend and the guy who stood up for me when I was being targeted for telling a TS guy off about harassing a former staff member. To you Poker, I wish I can repay this debt that you did for me. If you have a Steam, we can hang out. I have an active clan that I'm a part of on there for a specific F2P Steam game. Learn the ropes and Tier up then you can join us if you wish ;)

SnowSX3: A great mod and a better advice giver. Wish I could've gotten to know you better man and I wish that I could've gotten to the next level to see what good I could've done *Sad smile*. See ya man, you'd make a great Senior.

Auratix: A great Senior who congratulated me once when I handled a TS problem between two parties. He went to me for advice when I made an older post that constructively criticized staff and player actions. Despite me having no advice for him other than "More casualness and open behavior with normal players" xD

Thanks for being a good person to me :)

Cyanide: A great (Former) mod and person. He knew that when we were "off-duty" (No current reports or reports are being handled by other mods) that he can cut loose and joke about. I find him Charismatic :) Lead the staff-meeting that I attended.

Sli: Great Head MapDev who knew how to lead us with Evo. Despite the message sent to me... I wish we could've parted on better terms than this man...

RileGuy: Casual and relaxed person who lead a build team that I used to be a part of. You keep makin' those maps man ;)

Skyadia: HOOPS! I love ya man :) A great friend and an even better builder xD Wish we could've finished that tree map man. Well, see ya man. And keep buildin'!

Robin: An honest fellow and a great friend. This guy gave me sound advice that caused me to become the way I am today! For that, I thank you Robin. I hope to see you again hopefully if I ever come on again after tomorrow :) 

Bye my bae <3

MapDev team: Keep goin' on and boost the quality of Avi's maps. Choose 'em well guys.

I'll play some Nebula tomorrow then comes a decidedly long break. See you guys later (Maybe).

replies.body:
I was demoted for a few events that happened in the recent days. Just before my demotion.

If I took this to Skype I would have to contact multiple people. This is more or less a leaving post that also asks for a little more communication when demoting people.

Imagine, you wake up one day and you find yourself demoted. No Skype messages or anything. I didn't get a message on the moderators end and I found out the MapDev's message through Gmail. I was looking through Gmail for updates on a website that I write stories on.

replies.body:
Well, it shouldn't happen to anybody. At least a notification or a talk about why you will be demoted and what you could've done to fix. If these actually happened then the amount of Retired that don't rage will excessively drop.

This is one of the things that a lot of people complain when there is no communication or very little. It builds a hostile environment and people become distrustful of one another.

replies.body:
Aweh, Zinny!

Goodbye Zin, we've shared many amazing building experiences together, and had many awesome conversations. You are an amazing person, and it's really sad to see you demoted, and furthermore leaving all together. Thanks for like everything you ever done for Avicus, your contributions to Avicus have been extraordinary, and we won't forget you! Good luck with everything in life, and thanks again for everything you've done!
replies.body_tagged:
Aweh, Zinny!

Goodbye Zin, we've shared many amazing building experiences together, and had many awesome conversations. You are an amazing person, and it's really sad to see you demoted, and furthermore leaving all together. Thanks for like everything you ever done for Avicus, your contributions to Avicus have been extraordinary, and we won't forget you! Good luck with everything in life, and thanks again for everything you've done!

replies.body:
Goodbye,

I love how much you've changed and admitted to the mistakes you've made. Good job, and thanks for the work :)

I agree about the abruptness issues with that demotion, I had a similar experience.

replies.body:
I will always be there for you Zin :) I'll be there for anyone being harassed as a matter of fact. 

I'd like to thank you for helping me over the years with building my maps. You are such a creative person with your terraforming. Hopefully it doesn't end! Don't leave us! Stick around as much as you can please :D

replies.body:
What about my "thank you" for actually chaning ur attitude which got you staff? xd


Anyways thanks for the great times :)
See you bud
replies.body_tagged:

replies.body:
@Robin, Oh oh oh! How could I have forgotten to add you! You are one of my greatest buds out there!

Sorry for not including you on the post, there were a lot of thoughts going through my head trillions of kilometers per milisecond. Sorry! Sorry sorry!

I'm really grateful for your advice that you gave to me. It actually helped to calm me down and realize a lot of the mistakes I made. I became a calmer and even fairer person because of you man. Without you, I'd still be the sarcastic melodramatic xD

Thanks man, and see you around hopefully ;)

@Poker, I'll play minecraft with you guys all day tomorrow as a (Hopefully not) last voyage. Knowing my previous leaving post I think I'll come back. But I'm not so sure this time though. The way things progressed just seriously killed my will and I took a week break. (It said only 3 days ago before because I only came on for one game then left. I came on today for another game half-way through then left) I don't plan on forgetting you guys ever. 

Especially you, Poker ;)

@Frozen, eh... I sort of deserved it more or less. I could've temporarily retired and took a break and wait for things to die down. But instead I continued on and got myself into this mess. Although a little more communication would've been appreciated though...

Bye, and make sure to stay Frosty :)

I'm really grateful for your advice that you gave to me. It actually helped to calm me down and realize a lot of the mistakes I made. I became a calmer and even fairer person because of you man. Without you, I'd still be the sarcastic melodramatic xD

Thanks man, and see you around hopefully ;)

Especially you, Poker ;)

@Frozen, eh... I sort of deserved it more or less. I could've temporarily retired and took a break and wait for things to die down. But instead I continued on and got myself into this mess. Although a little more communication would've been appreciated though...

Bye, and make sure to stay Frosty :)

replies.body: I remember talking to you Zink and it was nice how thoughtful you were with map making.  You were one hell of a great worker and thank you for your service!

replies.body: Thing is dude, and this post really proves it, is that you are undeniably cocky. You always think you're right and when someone tells you otherwise you can't take it. Like i know i'm a bit like this but seriously you're not a bad guy, just way too much ego. Sometimes you have to let things go and acknowledge what you've done wrong so you can be better at it next time.
replies.body_tagged: Thing is dude, and this post really proves it, is that you are undeniably cocky. You always think you're right and when someone tells you otherwise you can't take it. Like i know i'm a bit like this but seriously you're not a bad guy, just way too much ego. Sometimes you have to let things go and acknowledge what you've done wrong so you can be better at it next time.

replies.body: Man, that's a real shame.  I remember when I was demoted, I had a notice about three weeks before hand, and although I can't seem to find that demotion message itself, I remember it being very kind and thanking me for what I had done.  It's kind of a shame to see how things have changed, and especially to see you go, Zintenka.  You were an amazing Jr Mod.  I know you probably don't have much to say to me, because I doubt you really knew me at all, but I have seen you moderate and casually talking to people, and you always seemed mature and kind.  Good luck in life, as they say.
replies.body_tagged: Man, that's a real shame.  I remember when I was demoted, I had a notice about three weeks before hand, and although I can't seem to find that demotion message itself, I remember it being very kind and thanking me for what I had done.  It's kind of a shame to see how things have changed, and especially to see you go, Zintenka.  You were an amazing Jr Mod.  I know you probably don't have much to say to me, because I doubt you really knew me at all, but I have seen you moderate and casually talking to people, and you always seemed mature and kind.  Good luck in life, as they say.

replies.body:
@Cynnamon, sure why not! My skype is Zintenka Brimem. What's your's?

@Spookeh, thanks man. And that's true but you see some of these people have VPN's which makes it pretty much impossible to ban them off of TS.

However, despite this being abusive... I annoyed a foul mouthed guy who kept calling me a "Bit**" and harassing other players including hipster. I was constantly kicking him from the server and moving him constantly around the server rooms. He got annoyed fast and left TS afterwards ;)

Sometimes, a little more extreme measures are needed.

@Poker, Hmmmm... I'll think about it... I'm not sure you guys are ready for my Bass voice again ;)

@Jracer, D'aawww... thanks for ze maps that you uploaded to the server and thanks for being a great person. With time, you will get better with YML to the point of coming up with experiments to combine and use different syntaxes for a great map. 

I'll stay around on the forums for a bit, though not in game. Today is my last (Hopefully not) time playing on the server... maybe. 

@BmB, Can you not do this...? Tell me which part that I didn't admit my mistakes? I will kindly point for you when I did. One of my responses to Frozen shows that this is partly my fault.

My only complaint was not getting a notification of getting demoted. That's all.

@Storm997, Yeah... the staff team is in a bit of a ditch right now. All they have to do is work together and pull themselves out of it. Thanks for the compliment man. We can get to know each other over Steam and/or skype if you wish ;)
